body_html:
The current behavior of tensorflow matches numpy:

# python
Python 2.7.12 (default, Dec  4 2017, 14:50:18) 
[GCC 5.4.0 20160609] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import numpy as np
>>> x = np.asarray([[1., 2.], [3., 4.]])
>>> np.sum(x, ())
array([[1., 2.],
       [3., 4.]])
>>>

So I think this is a documentation (not implementation) issue. Created a PR #19509 for the documentation fix.

body:
The current behavior of tensorflow matches numpy:
```
# python
Python 2.7.12 (default, Dec  4 2017, 14:50:18) 
[GCC 5.4.0 20160609] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import numpy as np
>>> x = np.asarray([[1., 2.], [3., 4.]])
>>> np.sum(x, ())
array([[1., 2.],
       [3., 4.]])
>>> 
```

So I think this is a documentation (not implementation) issue. Created a PR #19509 for the documentation fix.
